comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.ecpsoftshop.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ecpsoftshop.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Missed Ads (Site-specific request) > > Please add ad-blocking rules specifically for this website only. > > **Target Website:** https://www.ecpsoftshop.com/windows > > **Issue:** > This website displays advertisements, but AdGuard does not block them. > I am requesting ad-blocking rules that apply **ONLY to this domain**, not globally. > > **Details:** > - Ads on this page (such as banners or promotional sections) are visible. > - These ads remain even when AdGuard is enabled. > > **Steps to reproduce:** > 1. Go to https://www.ecpsoftshop.com/windows > 2. The advertisements on the page appear normally. > 3. AdGuard does not block them. > > **Expected behavior:** > AdGuard should block the ad elements **for this specific website only**, without affecting other websites. > > **Please add site-specific filters for this domain.** > ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.ecpsoftshop.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ecpsoftshop.com%2F) ### Comment > ### Missed Ads (Site-specific request) > > Please add ad-blocking rules specifically for this website only. > > **Target Website:** https://www.ecpsoftshop.com/windows > > **Issue:** > This website displays advertisements, but AdGuard does not block them. > I am requesting ad-blocking rules that apply **ONLY to this domain**, not globally. > > **Details:** > - Ads on this page (such as banners or promotional sections) are visible. > - These ads remain even when AdGuard is enabled. > > **Steps to reproduce:** > 1. Go to https://www.ecpsoftshop.com/windows > 2. The advertisements on the page appear normally. > 3. AdGuard does not block them. > > **Expected behavior:** > AdGuard should block the ad elements **for this specific website only**, without affecting other websites. > > **Please add site-specific filters for this domain.** > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/a4fx86sc9ygoos48wk4ccsscw084gs4aiossm0xdrs.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: hackle.io
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://hackle.io/ko/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhackle.io%2Fko%2F) ### Comment > I am writing to report a critical false positive regarding the recent addition of the hackle.io domain to your filter lists. > > We have identified that the entire hackle.io domain was globally blocked in the following commit: Reference: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/0de304ca17cf83e088a8ac4cb6829702766942fd > > While we understand and respect the goal of blocking tracking scripts, applying a wildcard block to hackle.io is causing severe disruptions for the following reasons: > > Disruption of Critical Functionality (Feature Flags): Hackle provides infrastructure for Feature Flags and Remote Configuration, which are essential for controlling application logic and feature rollouts. Blocking the API endpoints prevents applications from retrieving necessary configurations, leading to service malfunctions, not just a lack of metrics. > > Inaccessibility of Product Page: The current rule blocks the main landing page as well. This prevents legitimate users and developers from accessing the product documentation and service information. > > This global block is too aggressive and negatively impacts the user experience of services relying on Hackle for non-tracking purposes. > > We kindly request that you review this rule and remove the global block on hackle.io or narrow the scope to target only specific tracking endpoints, ensuring that core functionalities remain operational. > > Thank you for your time and prompt assistance in resolving this matter. ``` Username: @sungwoo-hackle ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/kix8j90whmo4wgos0c8kwg8cowswc88d5l8weng8xw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/i8699j5xcu0wgsws0o40cgs0880kkcok7c98qbfduo.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.14(1040) System version: | `ios 26.1` License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `system dns`
Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://hackle.io/ko/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhackle.io%2Fko%2F) ### Comment > I am writing to report a critical false positive regarding the recent addition of the hackle.io domain to your filter lists. > > We have identified that the entire hackle.io domain was globally blocked in the following commit: Reference: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/0de304ca17cf83e088a8ac4cb6829702766942fd > > While we understand and respect the goal of blocking tracking scripts, applying a wildcard block to hackle.io is causing severe disruptions for the following reasons: > > Disruption of Critical Functionality (Feature Flags): Hackle provides infrastructure for Feature Flags and Remote Configuration, which are essential for controlling application logic and feature rollouts. Blocking the API endpoints prevents applications from retrieving necessary configurations, leading to service malfunctions, not just a lack of metrics. > > Inaccessibility of Product Page: The current rule blocks the main landing page as well. This prevents legitimate users and developers from accessing the product documentation and service information. > > This global block is too aggressive and negatively impacts the user experience of services relying on Hackle for non-tracking purposes. > > We kindly request that you review this rule and remove the global block on hackle.io or narrow the scope to target only specific tracking endpoints, ensuring that core functionalities remain operational. > > Thank you for your time and prompt assistance in resolving this matter. ``` Username: @sungwoo-hackle ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/kix8j90whmo4wgos0c8kwg8cowswc88d5l8weng8xw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/i8699j5xcu0wgsws0o40cgs0880kkcok7c98qbfduo.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.14(1040) System version: | `ios 26.1` License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `system dns`
Filters: | Ad blocking:

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: hackle.io

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://hackle.io/ko/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fhackle.io%2Fko%2F) ### Comment > I am writing to report a critical false positive regarding the recent addition of the hackle.io domain to your filter lists. > > We have identified that the entire hackle.io domain was globally blocked in the following commit: Reference: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/0de304ca17cf83e088a8ac4cb6829702766942fd > > While we understand and respect the goal of blocking tracking scripts, applying a wildcard block to hackle.io is causing severe disruptions for the following reasons: > > Disruption of Critical Functionality (Feature Flags): Hackle provides infrastructure for Feature Flags and Remote Configuration, which are essential for controlling application logic and feature rollouts. Blocking the API endpoints prevents applications from retrieving necessary configurations, leading to service malfunctions, not just a lack of metrics. > > Inaccessibility of Product Page: The current rule blocks the main landing page as well. This prevents legitimate users and developers from accessing the product documentation and service information. > > This global block is too aggressive and negatively impacts the user experience of services relying on Hackle for non-tracking purposes. > > We kindly request that you review this rule and remove the global block on hackle.io or narrow the scope to target only specific tracking endpoints, ensuring that core functionalities remain operational. > > Thank you for your time and prompt assistance in resolving this matter. ``` Username: @sungwoo-hackle ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/kix8j90whmo4wgos0c8kwg8cowswc88d5l8weng8xw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/i8699j5xcu0wgsws0o40cgs0880kkcok7c98qbfduo.png?nc=1)

Filters: | Ad blocking:

comment.body:
@zloyden, do you know why we block things like this in both the Annoyance and Social filters, but we donâ€™t block things like this: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/217783 in both the Annoyance and Tracking filters?

Last time I asked why it was only in the Annoyance filter, I got this reply: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/180421#issuecomment-2139013184. Now it's the other way around.

comment.body:
I'm not sure, but it looks like that HTTPS filtering does not work correctly (at least for these requests) and it's similar to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/217135#issuecomment-3505114488

Do you have `Filter HTTP/3` option in Advanced Settings enabled?
If so, please try to disable it.

In general it does not look like filter list issue.

comment.body:
@krystian3w MÃ³gÅ‚byÅ› proszÄ™ spojrzeÄ‡?
Problem powoduje:
```adblock
##.scroll-button:not(body, html, .wrapper):lang(pl)
```
z listy `Polish Annoyances Filters`.
https://github.com/FiltersHeroes/PolishAnnoyanceFilters/blob/03d00ce2eb9292b7aa555595523dd2f507f07c0b/PPB.txt#L4343

<hr>

Tymczasowe rozwiÄ…zanie:

comment.body: I noticed a bug when making this report. The reporting tool would not let me continue. it said "Annoyance filters are required for quality filtering. Please enable them in AdGuard". However, I already had them enabled. The only way to fix it was to manually add the AdGuard Annoyances filter to the list.
